recipe.name: Dan Dan Noodle Soup (Vegetarian)
recipe.description: This Chinese noodle soup is a flavour explosion in a bowl, is <300 cal per serving and only takes just over 10 minutes to make. It is spicy, salty and slightly sour with the fragrance of sesame, with a thicker soup than the usual clear noodle soup stocks and I love the creamy colour and texture which comes from the sesame paste (or tahini), corn starch and the starch from cooking the noodles in the stock. Substitute the vegetables with whatever you have on hand and use whatever noodles you want.
recipeIngredient: 400 g dried rice stick noodles ((see notes))
4 cups (32 oz/1 litre)   vegetable or chicken stock (broth)
2 tsp chilli bean sauce ((or substitute with another chilli paste or sauce). Adjust to taste!)
2  medium carrots (, peeled and sliced diagonally)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine stock ingredients in a large pot and bring to boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine stock ingredients in a large pot and bring to boil.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, mix the Stock Sauce ingredients together in a small bowl and cut all the vegetables into bite size pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, mix the Stock Sauce ingredients together in a small bowl and cut all the vegetables into bite size pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the Stock Sauce and mix well to dissolve into the soup. Adjust seasoning as required.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the Stock Sauce and mix well to dissolve into the soup. Adjust seasoning as required.

recipeInstructions.text: When the stock comes to a boil, place rice stick noodles in the stock, then 1 minute later add the carrots and broccoli, then 1 minute later remove from heat and add the bok choy stems.
recipeInstructions.name: When the stock comes to a boil, place rice stick noodles in the stock, then 1 minute later add the carrots and broccoli, then 1 minute later remove from heat and add the bok choy stems.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the noodles and vegetables between bowls, top with the bok choy leaves and bean sprouts.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the noodles and vegetables between bowls, top with the bok choy leaves and bean sprouts.

recipeInstructions.text: Ladle soup into bowls over the vegetables and noodles, and garnish with spring onions.

recipeInstructions.text: Optional: finish with chilli oil and more chilli paste - if you can handle the heat!

review.reviewBody: Quick and healthy meal. My family loves this! I've made the recipe a few times as written but can't wait to try some variations. This will be a regular on our meal plans.

Love this soup! I omitted the cornflour and used different veggies that I had. I've been enjoying all your soups, but I think this is my favourite.  Amazing to discover the magic soup ingredient tahini! Makes it nutty and creamy without having to use dairy, coconut milk or flour.
I agree, I think it might possibly meant to be teaspoons of soy sauce/vinegar, not tablespoons?

Well, I think it's about time I write a review for this recipe and sing your praise online Nagi. This has been on a regular rotation for nearly 3 years now!! It is our favourite by far, and has since become our friend's/family's favourite too. I always stick to the original recipe and measurements, with the only change using garlic oil (garlic is no-go for me). I do however vary the toppings based on what is in the fridge - lately my favourite is grated zucchini. I wouldn't normally comment with advice, but I've had the tahini split many times and found that if I stick to the following tips it doesn't happen anymore! I always mix in a little of the Stock first to the Stock Sauce, to make a better "blend". Most importantly, make sure the Stock is never hot or boiling prior to adding the Stock Sauce. Keep stirring. Only allow it the mix to come to a boil once you've added noodles, and keep stirring. I just hope that helps anyone else who tries this AMAZING recipe. Thank you Nagi, love your work!
Love this recipe. Simple and tasty, when you are sick of lockdown cooking. Thank you!

Straightforward recipe - loved it! Mine ended up looking really orange because I added a small amount of fresh turmeric and I topped it with a ramen egg, so I added the egg marinade (soy sauce/mirin) to the soup mix too - waste not want not ;)
We followed the recipe with a bit of fish sauce for seasoning (I also added extra ginger and shiitake mushrooms and tofu). It was delicious.

Hi Nagi, thanks for the great recipe! It's summer where I live but being born raised and bred Asian I could never resist a lovely noodle soup <3 I'm gonna make it again for my friends, I'm sure they'll be over the moon!
